comment: I have had bad professors before, but this guy might take home the cake. He didn't give any material before the midterm except for 5 textbooks, none of which he explained what we should read. Our term project was copy pasted from another professor, and he changed due dates and deliverables without updating the project text or notifying us.

This professor does not teach and has no clue what he is doing. We were quizzed on many random and unrelated topics - all seemingly copy and pasted from other professors or the internet. He does not post any material, slides, or lectures. Just links to massive textbooks with no indication of what we should be reading or doing. Pro: he grades easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: He was fine. I would take him online though.

RNG is his main tool for grading. Quizzes and tests have questions never seen before, and projects make no sense, but he will give you a good grade if you write 20 pages of non-sense. 2-3 lectures a week, but you can not understand what he is saying. I would avoid him if any other prof is available.

As everyone else said, just has a million slides. No way of knowing which ones he'll quiz/test you on, but half of the quiz/test questions are irrelevant to the slides anyway. Audio on lectures is just awful, and he teaches like he's bored of it. He said he doesn't give over a 95 on assignments, but he doesn't grade too harshly. No rubrics.

I agree with most reviews above, he doesn't teach. Mostly he just plays videos or runs slides n reads them. Rubrics are told on last day before you get final grade. Feedback is vague indeed and grades do seem random, your not sure why got a particular grade and if you mail him, he'd respond it's relative. I'd say skip it if optional subject.

Will not teach any actual content. Useless 70+ slide ppts and his lecture videos sound like they were recorded inside of a jet engine. Sets specific start & end times for quizzes & tests for an asynchronous class, doesn't care if the time works for you. His assignments don't make sense but it doesn't matter because he'll just RNG your grade anyway
rating_tags: So many papers--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He just sits in his chair staring at the wall while prerecorded lectures play. Instructions/details for projects and exams are sparse, and the ones that are given are vague (and that's being generous). Avoid him like the plague.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Posted recordings from last year and skimmed through the material very quickly with little to no explanation. Does not grade assignments fairly and directions are very vague.

He practically refused to actually teach my class. I signed up for a face to face class to avoid teachers trying to teach through just videos or powerpoints but all he did was just sit behind his podium playing us videos of him teaching a class over a year ago. I feel cheated that I actually paid for this class when the teacher doesn't even teach

If you have the choice to take another professor for CS 3502, do it. Dr. Ahmed has been the most difficult professor I have ever worked with. The course work consists of weekly powerpoints (all 50+ slides) that he doesn't explain, homework that has unclear instructions, and a 'semester long' project that he gives you a few weeks to complete.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Gave a lot of deadline extension when the class was having trouble understanding the assignment. Test are somewhat difficult but passable. Quizzes are really easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--So many papers

comment: He's not funny. I say he is hilarious because he's clearly a joke. He did not bother even opening up and looking at my assignments much less providing a clear rubric. He pretty much hands out grades based solely on his gut, so expect to receive useless feedback. He is also unwilling to change grades, and sometimes does not respond to emails

He kinda has an accent but is honestly one of the better CS professors. Lectures aren't bad, just go and you'll do good. He gives good study guides for the tests, hints to quiz/test questions, is a lenient grader, and works with students on due dates. Never read the textbook just went to lecture/office hours. 2 HW, Midterm, Final, 1 Proj, 2 Quiz.

Dr. Ahmed doesn't teach. You won't learn anything. YouTube is your professor. His "lecture videos" are him scrolling through the (3!) textbooks saying "You might need to know this or that," never teaching. It's his job to teach, not ours to know. The whole class was a joke for multiple reasons (out of space). Dr. Ahmed needs to learn to teach.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Super weird class. So it seems super hard at first but he grades incredibly easy. If you do the assignments and answer everything as best as you can on the test you will get a high grade. Also a super weird project at the end but he gives some started code so if you try your best you will do fine.
